original: @353b / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: @353b / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to the Blessed Buddhas.

original: rgyal ba rnam gzigs mya ngan 'tshang la gnas //
analyzed: rgyal ba rnam gzigs mya ngan 'tshang la gnas //
translated: The Victor Vairocana was at the foot of the Aśoka tree;

original: rgyal ba gtsug tor padma dkar po'i drung //
analyzed: rgyal ba gtsug tor padma dkar po'i drung //
translated: The Victor Ūrṇā was at the foot of a white lotus;

original: thams cad skyob ba s'a la'i drung na gnas //
analyzed: thams cad skyob ba s'a la'i drung na gnas //
translated: Viśvabhū was at the foot of a sāl tree;

original: bram ze 'khor ba 'jig ni shir sha'i drung //
analyzed: bram ze 'khor ba 'jig ni shir sha'i drung //
translated: Brahmā was at the foot of a śirīṣa tree;

original: sangs rgyas  aa du ma b'a ra'i drung //🔽'od srung n+ya gro dha yi drung na gnas //
analyzed: sangs rgyas  aa du ma b'a ra'i drung // 'od srung n+ya gro dha yi drung na gnas //
translated: The Buddha was at the foot of an udumbara tree;🔽Kāśyapa was at the foot of a banyan tree;

original: sh'akya thub mchog khyad par gnas drung du //
analyzed: sh'akya thub mchog khyad par gnas drung du //
translated: The supreme Śākyamuni was at the foot of an aśvattha tree.

original: phyin nas byang chub thob gyur goo ta ma //
analyzed: phyin nas byang chub thob gyur goo ta ma //
translated: Having gone there, Gautama attained enlightenment.

original: sangs rgyas rdzu 'phrul chen po de dag la //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rdzu 'phrul chen po de dag la //
translated: To those Buddhas of great miracles,

original: @354a *// mngon par dad pa'i lha gang 'khod pa dag /
analyzed: @354a *// mngon par dad pa'i lha gang 'khod pa dag /
translated: Whatever gods are present with deep faith,

original: lha rnams de dag yid dga' mgur gyur nas //
analyzed: lha rnams de dag yid dga' mgur gyur nas //
translated: Those gods, with joyful and delighted minds,

original: rtag tu dge zhing zhi bar 'gyur bar byos //
analyzed: rtag tu dge zhing zhi bar 'gyur bar byos //
translated: Should always be virtuous and peaceful.

original: sangs rgyas rnams la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to the Buddhas!

original: rkang gnyis khyed rnams bde legs shog /
analyzed: rkang gnyis khyed rnams bde legs shog /
translated: May you two-legged beings be well and happy!

original: rkang bzhi khyed cag bde legs shog /
analyzed: rkang bzhi khyed cag bde legs shog /
translated: May you four-legged beings be well and happy!

original: lam du zhugs rnams bde legs shog /
analyzed: lam du zhugs rnams bde legs shog /
translated: May those who have set out on the road be happy.

original: phyir 'ong dag kyang bde legs shog /🔽mtshan mo bde legs nyin bde legs //
analyzed: phyir 'ong dag kyang bde legs shog / mtshan mo bde legs nyin bde legs //
translated: May those who have returned home be happy.🔽May you be happy at night, may you be happy in the day,

original: nyi ma'i gung la 'ang bde legs shing //
analyzed: nyi ma'i gung la 'ang bde legs shing //
translated: May you be happy at midday,

original: khyed cag kun tu bde legs shog /
analyzed: khyed cag kun tu bde legs shog /
translated: May you be happy in every way.

original: de dag sdig par ma gyur cig /🔽nyi ma thams cad dge ba yin //
analyzed: de dag sdig par ma gyur cig / nyi ma thams cad dge ba yin //
translated: May you not commit any evil.🔽May all days be auspicious.

original: rgyu skar thams cad bzang po yin //
analyzed: rgyu skar thams cad bzang po yin //
translated: May all the stars be propitious.

original: sangs rgyas thams cad rdzu 'phrul che //
analyzed: sangs rgyas thams cad rdzu 'phrul che //
translated: May all the Buddhas be endowed with great magic.

original: dgra bcom thams cad zag pa med //
analyzed: dgra bcom thams cad zag pa med //
translated: May all the Arhats be free from defilements.

original: bden pa'i tshig gis kun tu bde legs su gyur cig /
analyzed: bden pa'i tshig gis kun tu bde legs su gyur cig /
translated: By these words of truth, may you be happy in every way.

original: rig sngags kyi rgyal mo rma bya chen po las gsungs pa'i smon lam dang / bden tshig rdzogs so ////
analyzed: rig sngags kyi rgyal mo rma bya chen po las gsungs pa'i smon lam dang / bden tshig rdzogs so ////
translated: The Aspiration and Words of Truth Spoken by the Great Peacock Queen of Knowledge Mantras is complete.
